question_text: The weights, in pounds, of six packages are listed below: 12, 15, 15, 18, 20, 32.  What is the median weight of these packages?
subject: Math

question_text: A teacher recorded the scores of two quizzes for a group of students. The scores for Quiz 1 are: 70, 75, 80, 80, 85. The scores for Quiz 2 are: 65, 70, 80, 95, and $x$. If the average (arithmetic mean) score for Quiz 1 is equal to the average score for Quiz 2, what is the value of $x$?
subject: Math

question_text: In a recent survey, 25 students reported spending a total of 100 hours on homework during a specific week. Which of the following values can be calculated based on this information alone?
subject: Math

question_text: The heights, in inches, of five seedlings are recorded as follows: 4, 6, 8, 10, 12.  What is the mean height of these seedlings?
subject: Math

question_text: The table below shows the scores of four students on Test 1 and Test 2.  | Student | Test 1 | Test 2 | |---------|--------|--------| | Anna    | 85     | 92     | | Ben     | 78     | 88     | | Carol   | 92     | 95     | | David   | 81     | 85     |  What was the mean score on Test 1 for these four students?
subject: Math

question_text: The table below shows the number of hours two students, Aisha and Ben, spent studying each day for a week.  Data set C (Aisha's study hours): 2, 3, 4, 2, 3, 4, 5 Data set D (Ben's study hours): 1, 2, 2, 3, 3, 3, 4  Which of the following statements correctly compares the means of data set C and data set D?
subject: Math

question_text: The number of hours per week students spend studying is summarized in the box plot above for a group of students. Which of the following is closest to the median number of hours?  ![](_page_6_Picture_2.jpeg)  1.7
subject: Math

question_text: The table below shows the number of books read by students in a class during a summer reading program.  | Student | Number of Books Read | |---------|-----------------------| | Ava     | 12                    | | Ben     | 8                     | | Chloe   | 10                    | | Daniel  | 15                    | | Emily   | 11                    | | Fatima  | 9                     | | George  | 14                    |  What is the range of the number of books read by these students?
subject: Math

question_text: The table gives the results of a survey of 200 students who were asked about the number of books they read for pleasure in the last year. How many students read 10 books or fewer?
subject: Math

question_text: #### Five Tallest Buildings in Metropolis  | Building Name       | Height (meters) | |---------------------|-----------------| | Metropolis Tower 1 | 450             | | Metropolis Tower 2 | 420             | | Metropolis Plaza   | 380             | | Metropolis Center  | 400             | | Metropolis Grand   | 350             |  The table above shows the height, in meters, of the five tallest buildings in Metropolis. Based on the table, what is the mean height of these five buildings, to the nearest meter?
subject: Math

question_text: The bar graph shows the distribution of the number of apples sold by a farmer at a market over five days. How many apples were sold on Wednesday?
subject: Math

question_text: A local bakery tracked the number of croissants sold each day for a week. The bar graph below shows the number of croissants sold from Monday to Friday. What is the mean number of croissants sold per day during these five days?
subject: Math

question_text: The number of points scored by a player in 5 games are shown below.  | Game          | 1  | 2  | 3  | 4  | 5  | |---------------|----|----|----|----|----| | Points scored | 19 | 20 | 20 | 20 | 21 |  Over these 5 games, which of the following is NOT equal to 20 points?
subject: Math

question_text: Monthly Sales of Two Stores (in thousands of dollars)  | Store   | Month 1 | Month 2 | Month 3 | Month 4 | |---------|---------|---------|---------|---------| | Store A | 100     | 120     | 110     | 90      | | Store B | 80      | 95      | 105     | 120     | | Total   | 180     | 215     | 215     | 210     |  The table above shows the monthly sales in thousands of dollars for two different stores over four months. No store is part of both Store A and Store B. Which of the following statements are true about the monthly sales for the 4 months shown?  - 1. The mean monthly sales for Store A is greater than the mean monthly sales for Store B. - 2. The median monthly sales for Store A is greater than the median monthly sales for Store B.
subject: Math

question_text: The bar graph shows the number of books read by students in each grade level during the summer break.  [Bar graph description: The x-axis shows grade levels: 6th Grade, 7th Grade, 8th Grade. The y-axis shows the number of books read. Bars are as follows: 6th Grade - height 25, 7th Grade - height 32, 8th Grade - height 20.]  How many fewer books were read by 8th-grade students compared to 6th-grade students?
subject: Math

question_text: Last week, a bakery sold a total of 75 pastries.  According to the sales records, 22 pastries were croissants, 18 were muffins, and 20 were scones. The remaining pastries sold were cookies. How many cookies were sold last week?
subject: Math

question_text: Scores of 25 Students on a History Quiz  | Score | Frequency | |-------|-----------| | 50    | 5         | | 60    | 3         | | 70    | 6         | | 80    | 2         | | 90    | 3         | | 150   | 1         |  The table above shows the distribution of scores of 25 students on a history quiz. Which of the following gives the correct order of the mean, median, and mode of the scores?
subject: Math

question_text: The results of two independent surveys on student test scores are shown in the table below.  |   | Test Scores |     |                                                                             |  |  |  | |---|-------------|-----|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|--|--|--| |   |             |     | Group   Sample size   Mean (points)   Standard deviation (points) |  |  |  | | X | 400         | 72  | 4.5                                                                       |  |  |  | | Y | 400         | 72  | 7.8                                                                       |  |  |  |  Which statement is true based on the table?
subject: Math

question_text: The weights, in pounds, of five packages are 20, 22, 25, 23, and $x$. The mean and the median of these five weights are equal. Which of the following is NOT a possible value of $x$?
subject: Math

question_text: The table below shows the average monthly rent, in dollars, for a one-bedroom apartment in nine different cities in 2022 and 2023. Based on the information given in the table, how much greater was the median average monthly rent in these cities in 2023 than the median average monthly rent in 2022?  | City         | 2022 Rent | 2023 Rent | |--------------|-----------|-----------| | New York     | 3200      | 3400      | | Los Angeles  | 2800      | 3000      | | Chicago      | 2100      | 2200      | | Houston      | 1800      | 1950      | | Phoenix      | 1700      | 1850      | | Philadelphia | 1900      | 2050      | | San Antonio  | 1500      | 1600      | | San Diego    | 2500      | 2700      | | Dallas       | 1950      | 2100      |
subject: Math

question_text: The table below shows the number of cupcakes sold each day at a bakery during one week. What is the median number of cupcakes sold per day during this week?  | Day     | Number of Cupcakes Sold | |---------|-------------------------| | Monday    | 45                      | | Tuesday   | 52                      | | Wednesday | 48                      | | Thursday  | 55                      | | Friday    | 60                      | | Saturday  | 62                      | | Sunday    | 50                      |
subject: Math

question_text: The number of books read by 9 students in a summer reading program are recorded in four different lists below. For which list of books is the mean number of books read greater than the median number of books read?
subject: Math

question_text: The scores of 8 students on a quiz were initially recorded. The mean, median, range, and standard deviation of these scores were calculated. It was later discovered that the student with the highest recorded score actually scored 5 points less than what was initially recorded. If the four values are recalculated using the corrected score, which value will remain unchanged?
subject: Math

question_text: A coffee shop owner recorded the number of customers served each hour for two different days.   Day 1 data set (Customers per hour): 25, 25, 25, 25, 25, 25, 25, 25, 25, 25 Day 2 data set (Customers per hour): 25, 25, 25, 25, 25, 25, 25, 25, 25, 50  Which of the following statements about the means and medians of the number of customers served per hour for Day 1 and Day 2 is true?
subject: Math

question_text: A set of data consists of thirteen consecutive integers. If '$m$' represents the mean of this set and '$p$' represents the median, what is the value of $|m-p|$?
subject: Math

question_text: A botanist categorizes seedlings into three groups based on their heights. In Group X, there are 20 seedlings with heights less than 10 cm. In Group Y, there are 18 seedlings with heights at least 10 cm but no more than 25 cm. In Group Z, there are 15 seedlings with heights greater than 25 cm. Which of the following could be the median height, in centimeters, of these 53 seedlings?
subject: Math

question_text: 3, 12, 9  The mean of the list of numbers above is what fraction of the sum of the three numbers?
subject: Math

question_text: The number of books read by 8 students during summer vacation are recorded as follows: 2, 5, 8, 3, 5, 6, 7, 5. What is the median number of books read by these students?
subject: Math

question_text: A class of 25 students took a quiz. The set of quiz scores has a mean of 78 and a median of 78. To encourage improvement, the teacher decided to adjust the scores. For each student who scored above the median, the teacher added 6 points to their score. For each student who scored below the median, the teacher subtracted 6 points from their score. Scores exactly equal to the median remained unchanged. Which of the following measures does NOT have the same value in both the original and adjusted sets of quiz scores?
subject: Math

question_text: The frequency distribution below summarizes the number of books read by students in a summer reading program, where $b$ is a positive integer. How much greater is the mean number of books read than the median number of books read?  | Number of Books | Frequency | |-----------------|-----------| | 2               | $b$       | | 4               | $b$       | | 6               | $2b$      | | 8               | $3b$      | | 10              | $2b$      |
subject: Math

question_text: Two classes, each with 25 students, took a science quiz. The mean score for each class was calculated and is shown below.  Class P: 78 points Class Q: 74 points  #### Which of the following statements MUST be true?  - 1. Every student in Class P scored higher than any student in Class Q. - 2. The median score in Class P is greater than the median score in Class Q. - 3. There is at least one student in Class P who scored higher than some student in Class Q.  - A. III only - B. I and II only - C. II and III only - D. I, II, and III
subject: Math

question_text: The average height of 6 seedlings in a nursery is 25 centimeters. After the tallest seedling is transplanted to a larger pot, the average height of the remaining 5 seedlings becomes 22 centimeters. What was the height of the tallest seedling that was transplanted?
subject: Math

question_text: Four different delivery services, A, B, C, and D, recorded the number of days it took to deliver packages over a month. The following frequency tables summarize their delivery times. Which delivery service has the greatest mean delivery time in days?
subject: Math

question_text: The mean weight of 25 packages shipped by a company is 12.4 pounds. After one package is delivered, the mean weight of the remaining packages decreases to 11.8 pounds. What was the weight, in pounds, of the package that was delivered?
subject: Math

question_text: Data set R consists of the weights, in pounds, of 40 newborn babies at a hospital, where each weight is between 5 and 10 pounds. Data set S consists of all the weights in data set R as well as the weight of a premature baby that is 3 pounds. Which of the following must be less for data set S than for data set R?  - I. The mean - II. The median
subject: Math

question_text: Number of Students per School in District X  | School   | Number of Students | |---------|--------------------| | School 1 | 450                | | School 2 | 520                | | School 3 | 480                | | School 4 | 420                | | School 5 | 550                | | School 6 | 600                | | School 7 | 580                |  The table above shows the number of students in 7 schools in District X. The median number of students per school for all 30 schools in District X is 510. What is the difference between the median number of students per school for these 7 schools and the median for all 30 schools?
subject: Math

question_text: The tables below show the quiz scores for Kevin and Ashley in six quizzes. The mean of Ashley’s quiz scores is 3 points less than the mean of Kevin’s quiz scores. What is the value of $y$?
subject: Math

question_text: For a science project, students in class P and class Q recorded the number of seeds that sprouted from different packets of seeds. The table below shows the frequency distribution of the number of sprouted seeds for 10 packets in class P and 8 packets in class Q.
subject: Math

question_text: The dot plot represents a data set of the number of books read by 9 students during summer vacation. If a new student who read 21 books is added to this data set, which of the following measures will be greater for the new data set than for the original data set?  ![](0__page_13_Figure_4_modified.jpeg)  # Number of books read
subject: Math

question_text: The table below summarizes the scores of 20 students on a recent history quiz.  | Score Range | Number of Students | |-------------|--------------------| | 60 to 69    | 4                  | | 70 to 79    | 6                  | | 80 to 89    | 5                  | | 90 to 99    | 3                  | | 100 to 109  | 2                  |  Which of the following could be the median score for the students on this quiz?
subject: Math
